lines.text: [Andy Fairweather-Low's "Wide-Eyed and Legless" is playing on the car radio]
They're playing my song. Turn it up.
[Deric and Diana sing enthusiastically but raucously]
I'd like you to play this at my funeral.
I don't trust you - you'd get up and start singing the bugger.
Think many people'll come?
Not with your voice.
[Diana and Deric have gone to visit Aileen. Aileen is leaning over the bannister as Diana clumsily climbs the stairs backwards, sitting on her bottom]
Climbing upstairs on her what?
Er, on her own volition.
That is *not* what I said!
No, I thought it wasn't.
Ten minutes of this rain will do more good in half an hour than a fortnight of ordinary rain would do in a month.
Hello Lawrence.
It's Kenneth.
Oh, I knew it was something of Arabia.
[Deric is smoking a very smelly pipe]
What are you smoking, lad?
Three Nuns.
Well I think one of them's just farted. Put it out, Deric. Never fools anyone, anyway.
[Deric is sitting with Diana in hospital]
Go and have a smoke.
I don't want one.
You're not missing much.

[kisses Diana]
Oh, I don't know.
Well go and have a beer then.
I don't want a beer either.
Well screw one of the nurses.
Oh, all right (!)
Only the one, mind - you've a train to catch.
